channel.title: Issue with Map Generator
channel.description:
Hey guys I'm having a bit stuck when it comes to using the RSC Map generator. I import it through my IDE and then load my land.jag, land.mem, maps.jag and maps.mem from my client into the cache folder in RSC Map generator file. Instead of printing out my map though. I just get the default rsc map. I have read all the comments in the config.java.
Additional info -This is the Map generator I'm using [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/8lwhujjsy84h9ln/RSC%20Map%20Generator.rar?dl=1]https://www.dropbox.com/s/8lwhujjsy84h9ln/RSC%20Map%20Generator.rar?dl=1[/url] (created by imthenull).
Edit: After reading through the original thread I realized that it will generate the default rsc map unedited. How can I make it generate my edited rsc map if at all possible?

@Aleka wrote:

Thanks for finding the time bro.

item.title: Issue with Map Generator
item.dc:creator: @Aleka Aleka
item.description:
@Aleka wrote:

Just the regular landscape editor of off rscdump. So it doesn’t edit the cache? How could I get the map generator to upload my landscape.rscd?

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with Map Generator
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

What did you use to edit your landscape? I wasn’t aware anything existed for jagex cache landscape formats.

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with Map Generator
item.dc:creator: @Aleka Aleka
item.description:
@Aleka wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:2, topic:547854”] freeLand = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "land.jag"); memLand = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "land.mem"); mapsFree = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "maps.jag"); mapsMem = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "maps.mem");

public static final String INPUT_DIRECTORY = System.getProperty("user.dir") + File.separator + "cache" + File.separator;

You first deleted the original files in the cache folder before copying your four files into it, right? As long as there are no “unedited” rsc map files remaining, it will either export an image of your actual landscape or it won’t and will crash.

When I am off work, I want to try using the BinaryLoader instead of the JagArchiveLoader. Hikilaka/Imthenull said that I just needed to change it in order to load the traditional landscape.rscd that I use.[/quote]

Yeah I completely removed the original files in cache and replaced them with mine before running it and still giving me the just the regular Unedited RSC map.

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with Map Generator
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

freeLand = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "land.jag"); memLand = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "land.mem"); mapsFree = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "maps.jag"); mapsMem = jagLoader.loadArchive(Config.INPUT_DIRECTORY + "maps.mem");

public static final String INPUT_DIRECTORY = System.getProperty("user.dir") + File.separator + "cache" + File.separator;

You first deleted the original files in the cache folder before copying your four files into it, right? As long as there are no “unedited” rsc map files remaining, it will either export an image of your actual landscape or it won’t and will crash.

When I am off work, I want to try using the BinaryLoader instead of the JagArchiveLoader. Hikilaka/Imthenull said that I just needed to change it in order to load the traditional landscape.rscd that I use.

Read full topic
